conbody.p: discussionIn the Discussion students have conversations either in pairs or groups. In the pair discussion mode, conversation partners within the group can be preset from the workstation ID, manually assigned by the teacher, selected by students themselves, or assigned by Dialog Nibelung at random.
Press Discussion button, select Whole group from the Select grouping method drop-down box, and press Start button ( ) to initiate discussion for the whole group.

fig.title: Discussion menu with Whole group grouping method

image.alt: Discussion menu with Whole group grouping method

conbody.p: Student panels of all students participating in the discussion will change their appearance ( ).

fig.title: Discussion participants in the classroom console

image.alt: Discussion participants in the classroom console

conbody.p: Select Phone conversation option if you would like to simulate speech quality characteristic to telephone conversations (reduced legibility, static noise, pops and clicks, etc.)
You can can listen to the conversation by selecting Listen option.
The teacher can also participate in the discussion by selecting Talk option.
Press Discussion button, and select Preset from the Grouping method drop-down box ( ) button to initiate discussion between preset pairs of students.
conbody.note: Preset pairs are assigned in ascending student workstation ID order, e.g. 1-2, 3-4, 5-6 and so forth.
conbody.p:
Select Recording option to record discussion into a file in MP3 format. The file will be saved in the Waves sub-folder of the teacher folder, e.g. Jason Miller\Waves\ENG101\2015-02-06\Group A (1-57 PM).mp3. In this example,
Jason Miller is the teacher name,
ENG101 is the class,
2015-02-06 is the recording date in year-month-day format,
Group A is the group,
2-57 PM is the recording time.
conbody.note: Listen and Recording options are available only for the whole group. You can use corresponding facilities from the student menu (_fixme_ xref) to listen and record individual pairs.
conbody.p: Conversation partners will be indicated in the classroom console by highlighting their names in the same color ( ).

fig.title: Conversation partners in the classroom console

image.alt: Conversation partners in the classroom console

conbody.p: Press Start button to activate discussion mode according to selected options.
Select Discussion from the Activity menu, then select Random from the Grouping method drop-down box and press Assign pairs ( ) to initiate discussion for randomly assigned pairs.
Press Start to activate discussion for randomly assigned pairs.
conbody.note: Press Assign pairs again to randomly assign new conversation partners.
conbody.p: To initiate discussion among manually assigned conversation partners, first select Discussion from the Activity menu, then select Manual from the Grouping method drop-down box and press Select ( ). Now you can assign conversation pairs by clicking on student panels in the classroom console. Press Select again when all pairs have been assigned and press Start to activate the discussion.
Select Discussion from the Activity menu, then select Student choice from the Grouping method drop-down box to allow the student to choose their own conversation partners ( ).

fig.title: Discussion menu for student choice of partners

image.alt: Discussion menu for student choice of partners

conbody.p: A Choose a partner window will appear on student screens ( ).

The left panel in this window contains a list of students available for invitation. Students should select a name from the list and press Invite to send an invitation. Already invited students have a green check mark displayed next to their name.

The right panel displays invitations received from other students. Student should select a name from this list and press Accept invitation to become conversation partners. This will form a pair and close the window.
conbody.note: Please note that once this window is closed, the students will not be able to change their choice.
The teacher can override student choices and assign new conversation partners by pressing Select button.
conbody.p: Press Start to activate the discussion mode.
Web cams on option is available in the paired discussion mode. When this option is selected the students will be able to see each other on their screens in the media player window.
